image.altText: Screenshots from a ghost store website.

props.synopsis: With Australians expected to spend billions this Black Friday, the consumer watchdog is warning about a growing number of "ghost stores" targeting unsuspecting shoppers and posing as local businesses promising premium goods, when in reality they are shipping fast fashion from overseas.

title.children: How to spot 'ghost stores' posing as Australian businesses

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is being challenged in the High Court on the grounds that it restricts young teens' implied right to freedom of political communication.

title.children: Social media ban for under-16s challenged in High Court

image.altText: A happy Anthony Albanese and a more serious-faced Sussan Ley in black and white cut outs on a colourful 90s style background.

props.synopsis: Millennials are bucking trends, becoming an increasingly progressive voting bloc and rewriting the long-held rules of politics, writes Isabella Higgins.

title.children: Millennials are the first generation to move left as they age

image.altText: Paul Brereton speaks during inquiry.

props.synopsis: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief executive Philip Reed writes to parliament apologising for inaccuracies in evidence given during Senate estimates.

title.children: NACC chief executive apologises to parliament for inaccurate evidence

image.altText: A pile of money sitting on a notebook on a table.

props.synopsis: Inflation jumps to 3.8pc in October, up from 3.6pc in September, according to new complete monthly data from the ABS.

title.children: 'Rate hike may be considered' after inflation rise to 3.8pc

image.altText: Strips of twisted metal lying on the street in front of shops.

props.synopsis: A man has died after he was struck by a tree during a series of storms that have lashed New South Wales.

title.children: Man killed by falling tree, 75,000 without power as 'ferocious' storms lash NSW

image.altText: Sydney University buildings on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Australia's top universities have aligned themselves with oil and gas producers, miners and developers on a a key piece of environment legislation, drawing the ire of dozens of academics.

title.children: Australia's top universities seek changes to key environmental reform

image.altText: Chris Minns New South Wales Premier standing outdoors. He has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The allegations are included in an affidavit by a former ALP state organiser, which was tendered during a secret hearing of a parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: Allegations surface of NSW premier's decade-old undeclared donations

image.altText: A photograph of a brown coloured model of a human brain

props.synopsis: The data showed there is "non-linear change across development" in the brain, suggesting it does not continue on one steady progression throughout your life.

title.children: Study shows there are four pivotal ages in your life for your brain

image.altText: An illustration of a pair of arms — one representing the US and the other China — with fists locked as if arm wrestling.

props.synopsis: The latest Asia Power Index shows Australia slipping behind Russia for influence, while the region remains dominated by the US and China.

title.children: Russia overtakes Australia in Asia regional power ranking

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, purple tie and white shirt stands speaking behind a lectern decorated with flowers

props.synopsis: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te says the budget was introduced for the country to defend itself in the face of a rising threat from China.

title.children: Taiwan announces $61 billion defence budget to defend itself against China

image.altText: Tony Burke in Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Greens senator David Shoebridge reads what he alleges to be extracts from a secret AUSTRAC report that has not been made public, in the Senate late on Tuesday.

title.children: Labor accused of turning blind eye to Nauru corruption allegations

image.altText: An anonymous woman examines paperwork in her hands.

props.synopsis: The federal government is consulting on major reforms to reduce financial abuse, including making it harder for directors to be appointed without clear consent. Economic abuse is estimated to cost the economy nearly $11 billion a year

title.children: Financial abusers appointing victims as directors in government's sights

image.altText: robert irwin and witney carson lift trophies at dancing with the stars finale

props.synopsis: The son of late wildlife conservationist Steve Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars US, lifting the coveted Mirror Ball trophy a decade after his sister won the same title.

title.children: Robert Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars — a decade after sister Bindi

image.altText: neon strip club sign saying 'crazy horse revue' with silhoutte of a seated woman

props.synopsis: A City of Joondalup councillor, who lodged an expense claim for a drink he bought at a strip club, resigns from the council citing "personal reasons".

title.children: Councillor resigns for personal reasons after 'accidental' strip club visit

image.altText: Footballers train by doing a passing drill with the ball at their feet

props.synopsis: The Socceroos, by pot luck, have avoided some of the sport's strongest nations for the 2026 World Cup pool stage.

title.children: Socceroos learn who they will not face in the World Cup pool stage

image.altText: close up of woman in blue check shirt looking at mobile phone

props.synopsis: Amanda's husband always seemed to just know things. When fiddling around with her social media settings, she discovered how he had been using technology to gaslight her.

title.children: Amanda's husband seemed able to read her mind. Then she learnt why

image.altText: A Tenterfield street lined with Pin Oaks in autumn, with colourful leaves.

props.synopsis: The combined value of land in NSW passes $3 trillion for the first time, as the affordability crisis sees property prices skyrocket in remote towns.

title.children: Affordability crisis triggers surge in outback NSW land values

image.altText: The right arm of an unidentified person with an Australian Federal Police badge showing.

props.synopsis: An apparent request across the public service to find and suspend low-priority spending would undermine security if applied to the AFP, according to its union.

title.children: Police union warns Labor 'austerity' drive would undermine security

image.altText: a male politician wearing glasses looking dismayed

props.synopsis: The results of Australia's most prominent election study show Peter Dutton was the least popular leader in four decades.

title.children: Voters rate Dutton worst leader in decades and prefer Labor on economy

image.altText: A headshot of a smiling woman with stringy brown hair framing her face.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court hears accused attacker Lauren Darul has previously had 16 warrants out for her arrest for failing to appear on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'broad daylight' Melbourne CBD stabbing refused bail

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie folds his arms as he sits in a chair.

props.synopsis: Murray Bridge parents of young twins who suffered dozens of rib fractures and injuries have each been jailed, after previously being found guilty of criminal neglect.

title.children: 'Deluded' parents jailed over criminal neglect of twin boys

image.altText: An office building showing a politician in a suit reading Tim Crakanthorp MP on the glass windows

props.synopsis: Jordan Patten, 21, has pleaded not guilty to all charges relating to an alleged plan to kill Mr Crakanthorp in 2024.

title.children: Man to face trial over alleged terror plot to kill NSW MP

image.altText: Smiling strongwomen stand on a stage and hold their trophies aloft.

props.synopsis: An Australian strongwoman has been dramatically promoted to second at the world championships after the winning athlete was stripped of the title because they were "biologically male".

title.children: 'Biologically male' athlete stripped of world's strongest woman title

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing in a park, she is wearing a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: A year after NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage handed down 35 recommendations from a landmark domestic violence inquest, those on the frontline say things are going backwards.

title.children: Is violence worsening in the region with Australia's highest rates of DV?

image.altText: A painted mural of Tony Abbott wearing a suit and rainbow tie marrying himself in a wedding dress and veil.

props.synopsis: Possibly the longest ever wedding ceremony is now over for former prime minister Tony Abbott, after Scott Marsh's mural was painted over.

title.children: Sydney mural of Tony Abbott marrying himself painted over

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have found no new evidence of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont as they conclude their fourth search for the boy today — a day earlier than previously planned.

title.children: No new evidence found as police conclude fourth search for 4yo Gus Lamont

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: The 66-year-old accused of killing two women in Melbourne in 1977 will stand trial over the murders, but has had a rape charge dismissed.

title.children: Perry Kouroumblis to stand trial over 1977 Easey Street murders

image.altText: Alana Starkie leans down and kisses her baby, who is covered in hospital tubes.

props.synopsis: A WA family has been devastated by the death of their newborn son at Perth's premier maternity hospital, and are desperate for answers on how the delivery of their fourth child went so tragically wrong.

title.children: Parents say baby who died wasn't properly monitored during birth

image.altText: A good-looking older couple in expensive clothing smile broadly.

props.synopsis: A down-to-earth Scottish woman who preferred to stay out of the spotlight, Ms Templeman was frequently credited by Sir Richard as a stabilising force on his career, providing a counter-balance to his extravagant personality.

title.children: 'Heartbroken': Richard Branson's wife Joan Templeman dies aged 80

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures as he stands in front of a large, blue and white airplane with the presidential seal on it at night.

props.synopsis: The United Nations body charged with fighting the spread of HIV says the Trump administration's cuts to the US foreign aid budget have sent the global aid response into "crisis mode".

title.children: UNAIDS says Trump's cuts have killed people and left millions without medicine

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four other people were already arrested and placed under formal investigation on October 29 and November 1.

title.children: Four more arrested in connection with Louvre jewel heist

image.altText: An illustration of four hands grabbing into a paper written 'Work and Holiday Visa'.

props.synopsis: Thousands of young Indonesians want the chance to come to Australia to work, but first they have to win a visa application "war" that puts them in the sights of scammers and dodgy operators promising them what they want — for a price.

title.children: 'The names have been selected': Crooked operators rig working visas

image.altText: A young toddler boy stands in muddy water flooding tents around him.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain causes significant flooding in Gaza, with thousands of Palestinians living in tents bearing the brunt of the sudden burst of winter weather.

title.children: Palestinians left without shelter after Gaza tent cities flood again

image.altText: man and woman smiling

props.synopsis: Helena Popovic took her father on a trip home to Serbia after he was diagnosed with dementia and believes its reminiscence therapy slowed the condition's progress.

title.children: Australians with dementia urged to revisit the past like Hemsworth family
